metadata.title: CVE-2018-6559 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The Linux kernel, as used in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and Ubuntu 18.10, allowslocal users to obtain names of files in which they would not normally beable to access via an overlayfs mount inside of a user namespace.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6559` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-42-generic - 4.15.0-42.45
linux-image-4.15.0-42-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-42.45
linux-image-4.15.0-42-lowlatency - 4.15.0-42.45
linux-image-4.15.0-42-snapdragon - 4.15.0-42.45
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-42-generic - 4.15.0-42.45
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-42-lowlatency - 4.15.0-42.45
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1029-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1029.31
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1029-aws - 4.15.0-1029.30
No subscription required

linux-image-4.18.0-13-generic - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-13-lowlatency - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-13-snapdragon - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-13-generic - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.18.0-13-lowlatency - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1035-azure - 4.15.0-1035.36
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1025-gcp - 4.15.0-1025.26
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1027-kvm - 4.15.0-1027.27
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1028-oem - 4.15.0-1028.33
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1007-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-42.45').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1029.31').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1029.30').
linux-hwe package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1').
linux-azure package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1035.36').
linux-gcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1025.26').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1027.27').
linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1028.33').
linux-oracle package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9').
